Definition: In this task, you are given a post in Spanish from online platforms. You are expected to identify whether the post is hateful against immigrants and women. A hateful post expresses hate or encourages violence towards a person or a group. If a post is hateful but not towards immigrants and women, it should be labeled as non-hateful. Answer "hateful" or "Non-hateful". Note that the URLs in the text have been replaced with [Link].

Positive Examples.input: Post: @medelcami01 Tu eres mi perra cierto
Positive Examples.explanation: This post contains explicit language "perra" and disrespects women. The English translation is "@medelcami01 You're my bitch right".

Positive Examples.input: Post: Enamorada de Arabe üòç siempre rompiendola @_eckoyg
Positive Examples.explanation: This post is positive because it expresses love and praises Arabe. The English translation is "In love with Arabe always breaking it @_eckoyg".

Negative Examples.input: Post: malditos √°rabes, como pueden entender esto
Negative Examples.explanation: You are expected to return "Hateful" or "Non-hateful". This post is hateful against Arabs. The English translation is "damn Arabs, how can they understand this".

Negative Examples.input: Post: Se nos rien en la cara @atleti y a vosotros os suda la polla.
Negative Examples.explanation: This post is unrelated to immigrants or women, and should be non-hateful. Although it uses explicit lanugage "polla", it is mainly for the purpose of emphasizing his or her disappointment. The English translation is "They're laughing in our faces @atleti and you guys are sweating your dicks off.".
